title: [K-12] Math Project-Based Learning Design for Open Educator Competency Development: Integrated Approach to Calculation, Formulas, and Graphing with Advanced Proof and Statistics

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics knowledge (algebra-geometry-probability-statistics) and teaching experience, proficiency in digital tools (Google Workspace, data visualization software), and basic proof-writing experience
context.additional_context: A project for corporate math educators using open educational approaches in digital environments: emphasizing numerical computation, numerical modeling, and big data analysis competencies for real-world problem-solving. It includes industrial-applicable optimization problems and simulation case studies.

learning_goals: Cultivate math learning design skills using OER (Open Educational Resources): integrating advanced formulas (polynomials, differential equations) and complex problem-solving strategies.

Use collaboration tools (Google Jamboard, Padlet) to create one open-ended project-based math education content incorporating function graph/probability distribution visualization and geometric proof processes. The content must use ≥3 visualization tools (linear/nonlinear charts, histograms, 3D modeling) and meet ≥4 of 5 peer evaluation rubric criteria (creativity, accuracy, collaboration, practicality, visual effectiveness).

Development of Analytical Skills for Educational Effectiveness through Peer Feedback and Formative Assessment: Application and Interpretation of Bayesian Probability/Inferential Statistical Evaluation Methods Based on Learning Data

resources: Digital Learning Platform (e.g., Google Workspace, LMS)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
